text: Donald Allen Bror Lindberg (September 21, 1933 â€“ August 17, 2019) was an American mathematician. He was born in New York City. He was the Director of the United States National Library of Medicine from 1984 until his retirement in 2015. He was known for his work in medical computing. Lindberg died on August 17, 2019 after falling at his home at the age of 85. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Accidental deaths from falls in the United States Category:American mathematicians Category:Scientists from New York City
title: Donald A. B. Lindberg
